keywords.indexterm: Content Reuseinsert a direct content reference

taskbody.context: You can use the same content in multiple topics by inserting a DITA content reference to that content. The following steps describe the procedure of inserting a DITA content reference:

step.cmd: Position your caret inside the element that you want to refer and in the Attributes view enter a value in the ID field.
step.info: In case you want to reuse just a part of the content of an element, select the content with your cursor, press Enter and in the proposals list select ph. This encapsulates your content inside a phrase(<ph>) element, allowing you to set an ID and then refer it.

step.cmd: Open the topic where you want to insert the reference to this element.
Click Insert a DITA Content Reference on the main toolbar.
step.stepresult: The Insert Content Reference dialog is displayed.

step.cmd: In the Insert Content Reference dialog, from the URL field, navigate to the topic that holds the element you want to refer.
step.stepresult: In the Target ID section of the Insert Content Reference dialog presents the elements that you can refer.

step.cmd: Click the ID of the element you want to refer, then click OK.
step.info: In case you select an interval of elements, the Conrefend field is filled with the id value of the element that ends the selected interval.
step.stepresult: A reference to the selected element is inserted at the caret position.To search for references made through a direct content reference of a topic, paragraph, list item and so on, use the Search References action from the contextual menu.
